Questo non è un gioco, è un'ESPERIENZA.
Da quando per la prima volta lo provai all'età di 8 anni me ne innamorai subito.
E' uno di quei giochi che esce ogni 10, forse 20 anni...
Per essere un gioco del 2004 la cura per i dettagli è Mastodontica: Storia, Personaggi, Gameplay, Musica: Tutto Perfetto.
Semplicemente, uno dei migliori giochi mai creati, e un grande classico.
Da avere e rigiocare.
Когда я буду старым сидеть с внуками, я расскажу им что эта игра предсказала весь апрель 2020 года

Игра - [u]балдеж[/u] , такого взаимодействия с окружающими вас объектами и физикой в целом, вы не найдете больше нигде, однозначно - [b]рекомендую[/b]

Really good story line I love that you can do so much in this game. I love in one of the missions how you can use the magnetic crane to throw cargo boxes on combine it's so funny! I love how they proceed to make more games, like Half Life 2: Alyx (VR) the mechanics are so good in that game. As well in this game.

Il aura fallu attendre 6 ans pour avoir des nouvelles de notre bon Gordon Freeman. 
Mais l'attente valait carrément le coup.  
L'histoire est longue, le game-play est extrêmement varié. L'histoire est tout aussi passionnante que le premier volet.

J'ai noté 3 points négatifs cependant :

- Les temps de chargement beaucoup plus long que le 1er jeu et qui freeze le jeu parfois une 15ène de seconde. Ca coupe un peu l'immersion
- La maniabilité du RPG. Je suis mort plusieurs fois en tirant des roquettes qui partent dans les choux pour se retrouver derrière moi, wtf?
- Les PNJ qui nous suivent auront beau vous aider. Parfois ce sera juste insupportable quand ils vous bloquent dans les escaliers, quand ils passent devant vous quand vous jeter une grenade. Attention à ce qu'ils n'activent pas non plus de mine... 

Mise à part ça, le jeu est fabuleux. L'univers est quelque peu différent que le premier HF et d'un point de vue scénario on se pose encore plus de questions à la fin qu'au début. Mais jouez-y. C'est une très très bonne suite du chef d'oeuvre qu'est son prédécesseur.

Игра полюбившаяса многим)
История которую тяжело забыть

When I first played, I wasn't very excited and gave up on the game. But then this year I decided to give another try, and now I can't stop playing! The graphics are amazing, and I love the story, I recommend this to everyone.

Its one of the best Games ever made. I renember the Demo Version of this Game. I was so Hyped when i was a Kid with my bad Computer. It was Laggy and i couldnt play it. 

Its really a must have for Half Life fans. If you want to Play Half Life Alyx then you should Play this games. Start with 1 and end with the last number.

1. Half Life 1 or Black Mesa (You can play both)
2. Half Life Blue Shift
3. Half Life Opposing Force
4. Half Life 2
5. Half Life 2 : Episode 1
6. Half Life 2 : Episode 2
7. Half Life Alyx

Tl;dr still waiting for you to learn a new number, Gabe…

[b]Final score: 3.5/5[/b]

The Half Life almost-trilogy is undeniably a very important piece of gaming history. And as little as you may care about gaming history and are much more engaged in the questionable political views and correlating low hygiene of gamers, Half Life is a milestone for Valve (read [i]God[/i]) as a company and the PC gaming industry as a whole. 

You'd have to lose yourself on some obscure middle eastern forum about Arabic poetry to not find people joke about “HALF LIFE 3 CONFIRMED TROLOLOL” because of how much an infamous cliffhanger Half Life 2 ended on. Naturally, after witnessing such a display of comedic genius under every post under the sun for the past +16 years, I was intrigued. And so, I finally decided to play this game everyone called the best game ever made, because it was made by God himself. 

Right off the bat, I can't go on without talking about my main guy, G, surname Man. The G-Man is hands down the most mysterious character in the Half Life franchise, if not in all of gaming. His voice actor, Michael Shapiro, did an amazingly fantastic job, letting his enigmatic and slithering delivery of his lines give us the mental picture of an alien lizard wearing a person suit as to not let his unimaginable appearance break your mind. Only Freeman's voice actor would come close to such a performance. 

Half Life's story doesn't have the most original plot but it is mysterious and fascinating enough that it keeps you interested and guessing and people are not waiting for a sequel to Half Life 2 because the cliffhanger at the end made it obvious that it would be a trilogy, but because the story is genuinely interesting. Though, while the story is more show than tell, I am still unsatisfied with the quantity of plot in this, especially considering that the story can be summed up in only a few sentences. Allow me to try: Earth has been invaded by a space dictator, so G-Man pulls you out of the limbo, a few years after the Black Mesa incident because his clients ordered the right man at the wrong place, and puts you on a path straight to the belly of the beast, the Combine Citadel. However, Gordon can't follow orders, gets distracted, talks to a hot girl and a bunch of non-story-related stuff happens (cue Nam flashbacks of the boat and car chapters) before he finally stands before the big bad guy, my psychiatrist. He destroys the building with energy balls that are conveniently spawning endlessly and -CLIFFHANGER-. The End. 

Certainly, anyone would be frustrated with this conclusion, if it were indeed the final chapter we would ever see, but my frustration with the lack of story content is more related to this game itself, which brings us to the gameplay. Half Life is most and foremost a shooter. This is not criticism, this is a statement and as little as I usually care about shooters, this game was pretty fun. Only close to the end did I realize that many weapons only store very little ammo and that I was saving them for no reason, but I still enjoyed myself emptying one SMG mag per person. The source engine is equally fun as it can be frustrating, when you're stuck on a single piece of plywood and are softlocked from proceeding in your xenophobic killing spree. Thankfully, Gabe invented the F5 button because he knew something like this could happen. Plunging from one shootout to another, the story is regrettably forgotten about, as most dialogue revolves around explaining you to go from A to B so that one day you may reach point Z, where all the story stuff is going on right now. In short, the story is awesome but there is not much plot. 

To calm down and look at something pretty, let's look at the graphics. Truth be told, I don't care much about graphics - I don't care much about anything other than “How fun is it and how little effort does it demand”, but I was genuinely surprised by how much they still hold up to today's standards. Most of the environment is interactable and can be played around with, which opens up a lot of possibilities for the use of strategic methods against your enemies, like throwing barrels at them, or throwing explosive barrels at them.

This is all great fun until you reach the point, I just call the city chapter. Please imagine lots of cursing and cussing in this part, because Steam won't let me type it out, but I honestly hated the parts in the city near the end. They legit pit you against 5 or more giant alien turrets that fire $200 custom made cartridges at 10k rounds per minute while you have 3 missiles. I don't know how I made it out there alive, so my best guess is, the enemies took pity on me and just despawned after an hour or so. Anything after this chapter was great and better than anything before in the game, so I can't complain too much. 

All of this high-octane action spectacle could be yours tooooo~! And all that for the price of less than 8€! I'm not even kidding. You have for sure seen the price before this review (if anyone ever reads this) and were probably as shocked as I was. If you have any interest in buying this game, I  wholeheartedly recommend it, especially when they are practically selling this game as cheap as they can. 
Good gaem.
Half Life 2 is a great game that is highly fun to play and it is also fun to hunt achievments for the game but all and all it is a really fun game

Серия игр half-life является одной из самых важный серий  начало 21 века.Весомый вклад принесла каждая часть.Первая-это первый шутер такого плана,а отсутствие катсцен и развитие сюжета непосредственно  в самой игре было революцией.Также она подарила нам серию игр CS.Вторая во всем превосходит первую часть.Ее мир,персонажи,геймплей и тд. запомнятся надолго.Один Сити-17 и Рейвенхольм чего стоит.Вас будет ждать невероятный путь ученого из Черной Мезы  в специальном костюме в мире,который надо освободить от гнета пришельцев.И я вас уверяю:этот путь вам явно не будет безразличным.Хватит думаю распинаться и о так культовой игре.10 монтировок и гравиганов из 10.

Skvělá příběhová hra.. I když není nejnovější, je skvělá! Hrál jsem i první díl ale ten mě takhle nepotěšil.
- Skvělý příběh.
- Logické překážky mi přijdou jednodušší než v jedničce.
- Dobrý gameplay.
Za celou hru se mi stal jediný bug, že Gman zemřel, když jsem sestřeloval "vrtulníky". :D

I have played and completed this game from several years ago, I spend time revisiting streams of gameplays of these game after Half-Life: Alyx was released. This was the first (now it's a retro) game I have ever played with the most physics, vast world and a rich story. I love this game, and still love it with its retro graphics, you'll surely love its BGM and environment dynamics. This vast world of half-life 2 is set in a scientific, alien and mutants atmosphere. I can still I still hear its reload, refilling sound of health gauge and amor suite. ahh damn what bliss
Es Half-Life 2, eso ya es suficiente para jugarlo
